intro: Libanotis athamantica, commonly known as the Greek bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
